verses.plain: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,

tokens.t: And the
spake unto Moses, saying,

verses.plain: Speak unto all the congregation of the children of Israel, and say unto them, Ye shall be holy: for I the LORD your God am holy.

tokens.t: Speak unto all the congregation of the children of Israel, and say unto them, Ye shall be holy: for I the
your God
holy.

verses.plain: ¶ Ye shall fear every man his mother, and his father, and keep my sabbaths: I am the LORD your God.

tokens.t: ¶ Ye shall fear every man his mother, and his father, and keep my sabbaths: I
the
your God.

verses.plain: ¶ Turn ye not unto idols, nor make to yourselves molten gods: I am the LORD your God.

tokens.t: ¶ Turn ye not unto idols, nor make to yourselves molten gods: I
the
your God.

verses.plain: ¶ And if ye offer a sacrifice of peace offerings unto the LORD, ye shall offer it at your own will.

tokens.t: ¶ And if ye offer a sacrifice of peace offerings unto the
, ye shall offer it at your own will.

verses.plain: It shall be eaten the same day ye offer it, and on the morrow: and if ought remain until the third day, it shall be burnt in the fire.

tokens.t: It shall be eaten the same day ye offer it, and on the morrow: and if ought remain until the third day, it shall be burnt in the fire.

verses.plain: And if it be eaten at all on the third day, it is abominable; it shall not be accepted.

tokens.t: And if it be eaten at all on the third day, it
abominable; it shall not be accepted.

verses.plain: Therefore every one that eateth it shall bear his iniquity, because he hath profaned the hallowed thing of the LORD: and that soul shall be cut off from among his people.

tokens.t: Therefore
that eateth it shall bear his iniquity, because he hath profaned the hallowed thing of the
: and that soul shall be cut off from among his people.

verses.plain: ¶ And when ye reap the harvest of your land, thou shalt not wholly reap the corners of thy field, neither shalt thou gather the gleanings of thy harvest.

tokens.t: ¶ And when ye reap the harvest of your land, thou shalt not wholly reap the corners of thy field, neither shalt thou gather the gleanings of thy harvest.

verses.plain: And thou shalt not glean thy vineyard, neither shalt thou gather every grape of thy vineyard; thou shalt leave them for the poor and stranger: I am the LORD your God.

tokens.t: And thou shalt not glean thy vineyard, neither shalt thou gather
grape of thy vineyard; thou shalt leave them for the poor and stranger: I
the
your God.

verses.plain: ¶ Ye shall not steal, neither deal falsely, neither lie one to another.

tokens.t: ¶ Ye shall not steal, neither deal falsely, neither lie one to another.

verses.plain: ¶ And ye shall not swear by my name falsely, neither shalt thou profane the name of thy God: I am the LORD.

tokens.t: ¶ And ye shall not swear by my name falsely, neither shalt thou profane the name of thy God: I
the

verses.plain: ¶ Thou shalt not defraud thy neighbour, neither rob him: the wages of him that is hired shall not abide with thee all night until the morning.

tokens.t: ¶ Thou shalt not defraud thy neighbour, neither rob
the wages of him that is hired shall not abide with thee all night until the morning.

verses.plain: ¶ Thou shalt not curse the deaf, nor put a stumblingblock before the blind, but shalt fear thy God: I am the LORD.

tokens.t: ¶ Thou shalt not curse the deaf, nor put a stumblingblock before the blind, but shalt fear thy God: I
the

verses.plain: ¶ Ye shall do no unrighteousness in judgment: thou shalt not respect the person of the poor, nor honour the person of the mighty: but in righteousness shalt thou judge thy neighbour.

tokens.t: ¶ Ye shall do no unrighteousness in judgment: thou shalt not respect the person of the poor, nor honour the person of the mighty:
in righteousness shalt thou judge thy neighbour.

verses.plain: ¶ Thou shalt not go up and down as a talebearer among thy people: neither shalt thou stand against the blood of thy neighbour: I am the LORD.

tokens.t: ¶ Thou shalt not go up and down
a talebearer among thy people: neither shalt thou stand against the blood of thy neighbour: I
the

verses.plain: ¶ Thou shalt not hate thy brother in thine heart: thou shalt in any wise rebuke thy neighbour, and not suffer sin upon him.

tokens.t: ¶ Thou shalt not hate thy brother in thine heart: thou shalt in any wise rebuke thy neighbour, and not suffer sin upon him.

verses.plain: ¶ Thou shalt not avenge, nor bear any grudge against the children of thy people, but thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself: I am the LORD.

tokens.t: ¶ Thou shalt not avenge, nor bear any grudge against the children of thy people, but thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself: I
the

verses.plain: ¶ Ye shall keep my statutes. Thou shalt not let thy cattle gender with a diverse kind: thou shalt not sow thy field with mingled seed: neither shall a garment mingled of linen and woollen come upon thee.

tokens.t: ¶ Ye shall keep my statutes. Thou shalt not let thy cattle gender with a diverse kind: thou shalt not sow thy field with mingled seed: neither shall a garment mingled of linen and woollen come upon thee.

verses.plain: ¶ And whosoever lieth carnally with a woman, that is a bondmaid, betrothed to an husband, and not at all redeemed, nor freedom given her; she shall be scourged; they shall not be put to death, because she was not free.

tokens.t: ¶ And whosoever lieth carnally with a woman, that
a bondmaid, betrothed to an husband, and not at all redeemed, nor freedom given her; she shall be scourged; they shall not be put to death, because she was not free.

verses.plain: And he shall bring his trespass offering unto the LORD, unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, even a ram for a trespass offering.

tokens.t: And he shall bring his trespass offering unto the
, unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation,
a ram for a trespass offering.

verses.plain: And the priest shall make an atonement for him with the ram of the trespass offering before the LORD for his sin which he hath done: and the sin which he hath done shall be forgiven him.

tokens.t: And the priest shall make an atonement for him with the ram of the trespass offering before the
for his sin which he hath done: and the sin which he hath done shall be forgiven him.

verses.plain: ¶ And when ye shall come into the land, and shall have planted all manner of trees for food, then ye shall count the fruit thereof as uncircumcised: three years shall it be as uncircumcised unto you: it shall not be eaten of.

tokens.t: ¶ And when ye shall come into the land, and shall have planted all manner of trees for food, then ye shall count the fruit thereof as uncircumcised: three years shall it be as uncircumcised unto you: it shall not be eaten of.

verses.plain: But in the fourth year all the fruit thereof shall be holy to praise the LORD withal.

tokens.t: But in the fourth year all the fruit thereof shall be holy to praise the

verses.plain: And in the fifth year shall ye eat of the fruit thereof, that it may yield unto you the increase thereof: I am the LORD your God.

tokens.t: And in the fifth year shall ye eat of the fruit thereof, that it may yield unto you the increase thereof: I
the
your God.

verses.plain: ¶ Ye shall not eat any thing with the blood: neither shall ye use enchantment, nor observe times.

tokens.t: ¶ Ye shall not eat
with the blood: neither shall ye use enchantment, nor observe times.

verses.plain: Ye shall not round the corners of your heads, neither shalt thou mar the corners of thy beard.

tokens.t: Ye shall not round the corners of your heads, neither shalt thou mar the corners of thy beard.

verses.plain: Ye shall not make any cuttings in your flesh for the dead, nor print any marks upon you: I am the LORD.

tokens.t: Ye shall not make any cuttings in your flesh for the dead, nor print any marks upon you: I
the

verses.plain: ¶ Do not prostitute thy daughter, to cause her to be a whore; lest the land fall to whoredom, and the land become full of wickedness.

tokens.t: ¶ Do not prostitute thy daughter, to cause her to be a whore; lest the land fall to whoredom, and the land become full of wickedness.

verses.plain: ¶ Ye shall keep my sabbaths, and reverence my sanctuary: I am the LORD.

tokens.t: ¶ Ye shall keep my sabbaths, and reverence my sanctuary: I
the

verses.plain: ¶ Regard not them that have familiar spirits, neither seek after wizards, to be defiled by them: I am the LORD your God.

tokens.t: ¶ Regard not them that have familiar spirits, neither seek after wizards, to be defiled by them: I
the
your God.

verses.plain: ¶ Thou shalt rise up before the hoary head, and honour the face of the old man, and fear thy God: I am the LORD.

tokens.t: ¶ Thou shalt rise up before the hoary head, and honour the face of the old man, and fear thy God: I
the

verses.plain: ¶ And if a stranger sojourn with thee in your land, ye shall not vex him.

tokens.t: ¶ And if a stranger sojourn with thee in your land, ye shall not vex him.

verses.plain: But the stranger that dwelleth with you shall be unto you as one born among you, and thou shalt love him as thyself; for ye were strangers in the land of Egypt: I am the LORD your God.

tokens.t: the stranger that dwelleth with you shall be unto you as one born among you, and thou shalt love him as thyself; for ye were strangers in the land of Egypt: I
the
your God.

verses.plain: ¶ Ye shall do no unrighteousness in judgment, in meteyard, in weight, or in measure.

tokens.t: ¶ Ye shall do no unrighteousness in judgment, in meteyard, in weight, or in measure.

verses.plain: Just balances, just weights, a just ephah, and a just hin, shall ye have: I am the LORD your God, which brought you out of the land of Egypt.

tokens.t: Just balances, just weights, a just ephah, and a just hin, shall ye have: I
the
your God, which brought you out of the land of Egypt.

verses.plain: Therefore shall ye observe all my statutes, and all my judgments, and do them: I am the LORD.

tokens.t: Therefore shall ye observe all my statutes, and all my judgments, and do them: I
the

footnotes.text: and…: or, that thou bear not sin for him
betrothed…: or, abused by any: Heb. reproached by (or, for) man
she shall…: or, they, etc: Heb. there shall be a scourging
holy…: Heb. holiness of praises to the LORD
